name: One-bowl Fluffy Pancakes
directions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Make a well in the center and add milk, melted butter (slightly cooled), vanilla, and egg.
Whisk the wet ingredients together first, then slowly fold into the dry ingredients until mostly smooth. A few small lumps are fine.
You can adjust the liquid amount to make the pancakes more or less thick.
Set the batter aside to rest while you preheat your pan or griddle.
Heat a nonstick pan or griddle over low-medium heat and lightly grease with butter or bacon grease.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake and gently spread it into a round shape.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the underside is golden, about 2–3 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden on the other side, about 1–2 minutes.
